branding.name: Top 5 Keto Recipes
branding.tagline: Delicious Low-Carb Recipes for Your Keto Journey

meta.title: Top 5 Keto Recipes | Easy Low-Carb Meals for Weight Loss
meta.description: Discover delicious keto recipes that keep you in ketosis. Low-carb, high-fat meals that are easy to make and taste amazing.

recipes.title: Bacon-Wrapped Avocado Eggs
recipes.description: Creamy avocado halves filled with eggs and wrapped in crispy bacon. This keto breakfast has only 2g net carbs and keeps you full for hours.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop out a bit more flesh to create a larger well for the egg.
Wrap 2 bacon strips around each avocado half, securing with toothpicks if needed.
Place avocados in a muffin tin to keep them stable. Crack one egg into each avocado well.
instructions.tip: Crack eggs into a small bowl first to make pouring easier.

instructions.instruction: Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 18-20 minutes until bacon is crispy and eggs are set.
Top with shredded cheese in the last 2 minutes of baking. Garnish with chives and serve.

tips: Net carbs: 2g per serving (4g carbs - 7g fiber / 2 servings)
Use a muffin tin to prevent avocados from tipping
Add jalapeños for a spicy kick

recipes.title: Creamy Tuscan Salmon
recipes.description: Pan-seared salmon in a rich garlic parmesan cream sauce with sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Restaurant-quality keto dinner in under 30 minutes.

instructions.instruction: Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear salmon skin-side up for 4 minutes until golden.
instructions.tip: Don't move the salmon while searing for best crust.

instructions.instruction: Flip salmon and cook another 3-4 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add sun-dried tomatoes.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in parmesan until melted and sauce thickens.
Add spinach and stir until wilted. Return salmon to the pan and spoon sauce over top.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve immediately.

tips: Use coconut cream for dairy-free version
Serve over cauliflower rice or zucchini noodles

recipes.title: Keto Cauliflower Mac and Cheese
recipes.description: All the comfort of mac and cheese without the carbs. Tender cauliflower florets smothered in a three-cheese sauce that's pure keto perfection.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F. Steam cauliflower florets until tender but not mushy, about 8-10 minutes.
instructions.tip: Don't overcook - you want some bite left.

instructions.instruction: While cauliflower steams, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cream cheese and stir until melted.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Add garlic powder and mustard powder.
Remove from heat and stir in 1.5 cups cheddar and all the parmesan until smooth and creamy.
Drain cauliflower well and place in a baking dish. Pour cheese sauce over top and stir to coat.
Top with remaining cheddar. Bake for 15-20 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Add bacon bits if desired and serve hot.

tips: Make it ahead and reheat - it tastes even better the next day
Add cooked chicken or ground beef for a complete meal

recipes.title: Keto Zucchini Lasagna
recipes.description: Layers of tender zucchini replace pasta in this meaty, cheesy lasagna. All the Italian flavors you love with only 7g net carbs per generous serving.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F. Lay zucchini slices on paper towels, sprinkle with salt, and let sit 15 minutes to release moisture.
instructions.tip: This step is crucial to prevent watery lasagna.

instructions.instruction: Brown ground beef with garlic over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat. Stir in marinara and 1 tsp Italian seasoning.
Mix ricotta, egg, half the mozzarella, remaining Italian seasoning, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
Pat zucchini slices dry. Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in a 9x13 baking dish.
Layer: zucchini slices, ricotta mixture, meat sauce. Repeat layers twice, ending with meat sauce.
Top with remaining mozzarella and parmesan. Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes.
Remove foil and bake another 15 minutes until cheese is golden and bubbly. Let rest 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh basil.

tips: Use a mandoline for perfectly even zucchini slices
Freezes well - make two and save one for later

recipes.title: Keto Chocolate Avocado Mousse
recipes.description: Rich, creamy chocolate mousse made with avocado - you'd never guess it's sugar-free and only 4g net carbs. The perfect guilt-free keto dessert.

instructions.instruction: Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a food processor or blender.
Add cocoa powder, sweetener, heavy cream, vanilla, salt, and espresso powder if using.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as needed.
instructions.tip: Blend longer than you think - 2-3 minutes for silkiest texture.

instructions.instruction: Taste and adjust sweetness if desired.
Divide into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving.

tips: Make sure avocados are very ripe for smoothest texture
Can be made up to 2 days ahead - flavors actually improve
